Type ICommandOptions

Namespace Machine.Fakes

Defines a fake framework independent fluent interface for setting up behavior for methods returning void (commands)

Methods

  • Callback
  • Callback<T>
  • Callback<T1, T2>
  • Callback<T1, T2, T3>
  • Callback<T1, T2, T3, T4>
  • Throw

Public instance methods

void Callback(Action callback)

Configures that the function supplied by callback will be called when the method under configuration is called.
Use this overload when you're not interested in the parameters.
Parameters
Action callback

Specifies the function which is called when the method under configuration is called.

void Callback<T>(Action<T> callback)

Configures that the function supplied by callback will be called when the method under configuration is called.
Use this for callbacks on methods with a single parameter.
Parameters
Action<T> callback

Specifies the function which is called when the method under configuration is called.

void Callback<T1, T2>(Action<T1, T2> callback)

Configures that the function supplied by callback will be called when the method under configuration is called.
Use this for callbacks on methods with two parameters.
Parameters
Action<T1, T2> callback

Specifies the function which is called when the method under configuration is called.

void Callback<T1, T2, T3>(Action<T1, T2, T3> callback)

Configures that the function supplied by callback will be called when the method under configuration is called.
Use this for callbacks on methods with three parameters.
Parameters
Action<T1, T2, T3> callback

Specifies the function which is called when the method under configuration is called.

void Callback<T1, T2, T3, T4>(Action<T1, T2, T3, T4> callback)

Configures that the function supplied by callback will be called when the method under configuration is called.
Use this for callbacks on methods with four parameters.
Parameters
Action<T1, T2, T3, T4> callback

Specifies the function which is called when the method under configuration is called.

void Throw(Exception exception)

Configures that the invocation of the related behavior results in the specified Exception beeing thrown.
Parameters
Exception exception

Specifies the exception which should be thrown when the behavior is invoked.
